titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to limit the terms of office for Members of Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits a Member of the House of Representatives from serving more than four full terms in the House and a Senator from serving more than two full terms in the Senate (excluding any part of a partial term to which the person may have been elected or appointed).
